events.name: CSESoc x Microsoft VSCode Extension Workshop
events.description:
Learn how to power up your development using one of the most popular coding editors 💻 

Extend your capabilities with VSCode 🔥 and forget that you ever needed to use:
ctrl z, ctrl z, ctrl z, ctrl c, 
ctrl y, ctrl y, ctrl y, ctrl v 😬

This workshop is sponsored by Microsoft and hosted by Adam Tizzone! 😎 an ex-intern and current engineer at Microsoft, who was previously Co-President of CSESoc 🎓 has been involved with the CSESoc Jobs Board and Attendance Tracker

Sign up: bit.ly/CSEVSCodeSignup 

Visual Studio Code (commonly referred to as VS Code) is a free, based on open-source and highly configurable text/code editor. This workshop will be centred around VS Code and explore the basics on how to use, navigate and configure it, as well as writing a very basic extension.

When Monday 5th October 3-5pm
Where: Event will run on Microsoft Teams
Who: You!

-------------- STAY IN TOUCH --------------
Facebook Group - https://bit.ly/CSESocGroup
Instagram - https://bit.ly/CSESocInstagram
Youtube - https://bit.ly/CSESocYoutube
Website - https://bit.ly/CSESocWebsite
LinkedIn - https://bit.ly/CSESocLinkedIn
Events Calendar - http://bit.ly/google-events-cal

events.name: CSESoc Speed Friending
events.description:
Starting university is hard enough as it is! 😓 With ongoing social distancing it’s been even tougher meeting new people and making friends online 👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 but CSESoc’s Speed Friending is here to help 🤩

Open to ALL!

But this is no ordinary speed friending … we will be using an AWESOME platform called ‘gather.town' 💻 A video-calling experience that lets multiple people hold separate conversations in parallel and lets you walk in, out and around those conversations just as easily as you would in real life 😱

On the day we will post an invite code so you can join the town 🏘

✨When: 12th Oct from 5:30-7:30pm
✨Where: https://gather.town/ 

-------------- EVENT DETAILS --------------
When: 5:30-7:30pm, Monday 12th Oct (Week 5)
Where: Online at https://theonline.town/
Who: All CSESoc members! 

-------------- STAY IN TOUCH --------------

Youtube - https://bit.ly/CSESocYoutube

events.name: CSESoc Online Cardboard Night
events.description:
CSESSoc is hosting another online Cardboard Night and we want you to join us! This is a great way to meet people online and take a break from the study grind. 

🌟 Sign up here: http://bit.ly/CSESocOnlineCardboardNight 

We'll be playing crowd favourites:
🔥  Among Us 🔥
🎮 Skribbl.io
🎮 Secret Hitler
🎮 Cards Against Humanity
🎮 Jackbox
🎮 Catan 

Be sure to sign up now and get your friends to join!

Video banner credits to 🌟 Gary Sun and Jacob Rendina 🌟 from the Creative team!

-------------- EVENT DETAILS --------------
When: 7-11pm, Wednesday 14th Oct (Week 5)
Where: CSESoc Discord (invite link at end of sign up form)
Who: All CSESoc members!

events.name: CSESoc 2020 AGM
events.description:
NOMINATIONS ARE OPEN FOR THE 2021 CSESOC EXECUTIVE TEAM

The Annual General Meeting is where we will:
⚡ inform you about what the society has been up to in 2020 
⚡ announce the 2021 CSESoc executives!

⭕ VOTING ⭕
To vote in the elections, you must REGISTER for the electoral roll here: http://bit.ly/electoral-roll-signup-2020 

Enrolment on the electoral roll ends 6PM 14 OCTOBER

A personalised voting link will be sent to your zID email once the election period starts. 

❗NOMINATIONS❗
These are the 6 executive positions available for 2021:
2 x Co-Presidents
1 x Treasurer
1 x Arc Delegate
1 x Secretary
1 x Grievance Officer

NOMINATIONS CLOSE 6PM 14 OCTOBER

Full job expectations and responsibilities are detailed in the CSESoc Constitution here: https://bit.ly/3ixWda9 

In order to nominate yourself or someone else for a position, please follow the instructions below: http://bit.ly/exec-nomination-guide 

For any questions please email copresidents@csesoc.org.au 

🔥 ELECTIONS 🔥
OPEN 9AM 16 OCTOBER 
CLOSE 9AM 21 OCTOBER

🎊 ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING 🎊
CSESoc will be holding our Annual General Meeting for 2020 to report on the year and announce and accept the voting results.

Sign up here: http://bit.ly/2020CSESocAGM
Join meeting here: https://unsw.zoom.us/j/88195215684

Agenda:
1. Apologies
2. Co-Presidents’ report
3. Treasurer’s report
4. Reports from Directors
5. 2021 CSESoc Executive Voting Results and Acceptance
6. Business without notice
7. Close of meeting

events.name: A Brief History of Video Games and Q&A with Marc Chee
events.description:
🎮ATTENTION ALL GAMERS!🎮

Are you an Epic™️ gamer 😎 or a casual 🥱 who has found yourself more immersed in the world of games in quarantine? This is your Call of Duty 🎖️ to spend a chill evening with other like-minded gaming enthusiasts including our very own renowned lecturer, Marc Chee 👨‍🏫!

CSESoc presents A Brief History of Video Games and Q&A with Lecturer Marc Chee! Held during the midterm break, you are invited to spend a relaxing night  ✨ with fellow gamers to discuss and learn about the history of video games! 

From Atari 👾 to Fortnite 🔫, we will be examining how tremendously the technological landscape has changed over the decades, as well as the current state of the video game industry!


📅 WHEN 📅
2 to 4PM on Thursday, 22nd October in Week 6!


📍 WHERE 📍
Livestream via Marc Chee’s YouTube Channel! 
The Stream Link will be announced near the event date!


✏️ SIGN UP ✏️
Complete this form with your full name and zID: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=pM_2PxXn20i44Qhnufn7o6ecLZTBorREjnXuTY-JfmBUOU9VVlhNRllDNFNSR0pIU1pLQjM4OFBEQS4u
